channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2023120214
item.description:
Report X-2023120214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was noticed a translucent inbound tote with an interior small box showing the letters "rosol". Suspecting aerosols, the tote was xrayed, Aeorosol confirmed. The rest of the shipment was put through xray. Following DG found in multiple plastic totes, not visible from the outside. Originally screened by K9. Items had flown twice on passenger aircraft 25OCT/RDMSEA/AS913 27OCT/SEAANC/AS93 6 aerosol cans 3 Lithium Metal Batteries 4 Lithium Ion Batteries contained in equipment

item.title: Report X-2023111354
item.description:
Report X-2023111354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While X-raying a shipment declared as dry food and clothing, seen was what appeared to be a rifle and another item that looked suspicious. Upon opening the container, discovered was an undeclared and unsecured rifle and a smaller case with a handgun and a loaded clip of ammunition.

item.title: Report X-2023111353
item.description:
Report X-2023111353

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Found 2pcs of undeclared hazmat, hairspray aerosols in one of the boxes during screening process. Noticed the aerosols when screening in big x-ray and opened the box. Box was filled with blankets and other household goods. The bottles of hairspray was located in the middle of the box with some cooking pans under the blanket.

item.title: Report X-2023111314
item.description:
Report X-2023111314

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: FAI
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023111314: [REDACTED - GEM/DATAOPS] was shipping out 5 totes plus one other item. When our ramp agent was helping unload the totes onto a cart, the ramp agent asked if there were any hazardous, dangerous, flammable, lithium batteries. The customer stated there were not. Cargo agent building the AWB also asked about batteries since he stated their were power tools. Customer stated no. When asked the check sheet questions "I certify that this cargo does not contain any unauthorized explosives, incendiaries, individuals, or other destructive substances or items. I am aware that this endorsement and original signature, and other shipping documents, will be retained on file for a minimum of 30 days from date of transport from accepting station." the customer verbally verified. After x-raying the totes, a handgun and ammunition as well as other possible items were seen. Searched all of the totes and found multiple spare lithium ion batteries per tote, handwarmers, handgun, ammunition, batteries, a dwalt btu propane burner that still smelled of propane All would have flown on Passenger AC X-2023111315: [REDACTED - GEM/DATAOPS] was shipping out 5 totes plus one other item. When our ramp agent was helping unload the totes onto a cart, the ramp agent asked if there were any hazardous, dangerous, flammable, lithium batteries. The customer stated there were not. Cargo agent building the AWB also asked about batteries since he stated their were power tools. Customer stated no. When asked the check sheet questions "I certify that this cargo does not contain any unauthorized explosives, incendiaries, individuals, or other destructive substances or items. I am aware that this endorsement and original signature, and other shipping documents, will be retained on file for a minimum of 30 days from date of transport from accepting station." the customer verbally verified. After x-raying the totes, a handgun and ammunition as well as other possible items were seen. Searched all of the totes and found multiple spare lithium ion batteries per tote, handwarmers, handgun, ammunition, batteries, a dwalt btu propane burner that still smelled of propane All would have gone on passenger aircraft X-2023111316: [REDACTED - GEM/DATAOPS] was shipping out 5 totes plus one other item. When our ramp agent was helping unload the totes onto a cart, the ramp agent asked if there were any hazardous, dangerous, flammable, lithium batteries. The customer stated there were not.
